content.question:
The function g has derivatives of all orders, and the Maclaurin series for g is

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mi>n</mi> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>n</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>n</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>7</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <mo>.</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaGZbdaaeWb qaaiaacIcacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaiykamaaCaaaleqabaGaamOBaaaa aeaacaWGUbGaeyypa0JaaGimaaqaaiabg6HiLcqdcqGHris5aOWaaS aaaeaacaWG4bWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaGaamOBaiabgUcaRiaaigda aaaakeaacaaIYaGaamOBaiabgUcaRiaaiodaaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaae aacaWG4baabaGaaG4maaaacqGHsisldaWcaaqaaiaadIhadaahaaWc beqaaiaaiodaaaaakeaacaaI1aaaaiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaamiEam aaCaaaleqabaGaaGynaaaaaOqaaiaaiEdaaaGaeyOeI0IaeyyXICTa eyyXICTaeyyXICTaaiOlaaaa@5B3C@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

(a) Using the ratio test, determine the interval of convergence of the Maclaurin series for g.

frqParts.text:
The function g has derivatives of all orders, and the Maclaurin series for g is

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mi>n</mi> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>n</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>n</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>7</mn> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <mo>.</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaGZbdaaeWb qaaiaacIcacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaiykamaaCaaaleqabaGaamOBaaaa aeaacaWGUbGaeyypa0JaaGimaaqaaiabg6HiLcqdcqGHris5aOWaaS aaaeaacaWG4bWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaGaamOBaiabgUcaRiaaigda aaaakeaacaaIYaGaamOBaiabgUcaRiaaiodaaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaae aacaWG4baabaGaaG4maaaacqGHsisldaWcaaqaaiaadIhadaahaaWc beqaaiaaiodaaaaakeaacaaI1aaaaiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaamiEam aaCaaaleqabaGaaGynaaaaaOqaaiaaiEdaaaGaeyOeI0IaeyyXICTa eyyXICTaeyyXICTaaiOlaaaa@5B3C@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

(a) Using the ratio test, determine the interval of convergence of the Maclaurin series for g.

(b) The Maclaurin series for g evaluated at x = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGaaGOmaaaaaaa@377B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is an alternating series whose terms decrease in absolute value to 0. The approximation for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39F0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> using the first two nonzero terms of this series is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>17</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>120</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39B1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Show that this approximation differs from <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39F0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> by less than <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>200</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38EF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
(c) Write the first three nonzero terms and the general term of the Maclaurin series for g'(x).

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
